answers.author: Roger Kolman
answers.text:
Yvonne:
The City of Chandler, AZ used to do this and may have some written policies on the program. Have you considered alternatives to trying to enter the retail market yourself? For example, it may prove more lucrative to license your logo to local retailers in exchange for a percentage of the gross sales. This would allow you to avoid having to dedicate labor and materials to the project, while taking advantage of the existing marketing channels of your local businesses.

author: Yvonne Kimball
text:
Hello, Colleagues
Has anyone had experience of selling city/town promotional items for a small profit? If so, please share with me your policy, procedure, etc.  I'm also interested in information regarding selling promotional items via the city/town's official webiste. I wanted to know legalality of this idea, success / failure stories, process, etc.  
My town is looking into first selling promotional items for a small profit, such as T-shirts with the Town logo and town hall impage.  We also want to explore the possiblity of allowing online orders via the Town's offiical webiste.  Any information would be appreicated.
title: selling town promotional items via town website
